Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Record field_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_field { F_R : Ring_theory.ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req; F_1_neq_0 : ~ req rI rO; Fdiv_def : forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q)); Finv_l : forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI } Arguments Field_theory.field_theory [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Field_theory.mk_field [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [radd rmul rsub ropp]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope [req]%function_scope _ _ (_ _)%function_scope
Record semi_field_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_sfield { SF_SR : Ring_theory.semi_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul req; SF_1_neq_0 : ~ req rI rO; SFdiv_def : forall p q : R, req (rdiv p q) (rmul p (rinv q)); SFinv_l : forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI } Arguments Field_theory.semi_field_theory [R]%type_scope _ _ (_ _ _ _ _)%function_scope Arguments Field_theory.mk_sfield [R]%type_scope [rO rI] [radd rmul]%function_scope (_ _)%function_scope [req]%function_scope _ _ (_ _)%function_scope
Field_theory.AFinv_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (rdiv : R -> R -> R) (rinv : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Field_theory.almost_field_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp rdiv rinv req -> forall p : R, ~ req p rO -> req (rmul (rinv p) p) rI

```coq
intros X p Hdec Henum. unfold enumerable, decidable in *. destruct Hdec as [f Hf]. destruct Henum as [g Hg].
exists (fun n => match g n with | Some x => if f x then None else Some x | None => None end).
intros x. specialize (Hg x). destruct (f x) eqn:fx.
- split; intros H; try contradiction. destruct Hg as [n Hn]. exists n. congruence.
- split; intros H.
  + left. intro Hp. apply H. rewrite fx in Hp. discriminate.
  + destruct H as [n Hn]. exists n. destruct (g n); congruence.
Qed.```

original: intros X p Hdec Henum. unfold enumerable, decidable in *. destruct Hdec as [f Hf]. destruct Henum as [g Hg]. exists (fun n => match g n with | Some x => if f x then None else Some x | None => None end). intros x. specialize (Hg x). destruct (f x) eqn:fx. - split; intros H; try contradiction. destruct Hg as [n Hn]. exists n. congruence. - split; intros H. + left. intro Hp. apply H. rewrite fx in Hp. discriminate. + destruct H as [n Hn]. exists n. destruct (g n); congruence.
